_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Rochester Meat Company, located at 1825 7th Street NW, is a production facility offering a wide range of meat products. Rochester Meat uses Anhydrous Ammonia as a refrigerant at this facility to provide cooling for the production and storage areas. The Ammonia System falls under the EPA Rick Management Program due to the system quantity in excess of 10,000 lbs. The Rochester Meat refrigeration system is a closed loop system with normal operating pressures that range between a low side of 0 psi to a high side of 185 psi. Due to the ammonia system expansion done in 2007 the systems maximum intended inventory is 21,500 pounds.



Process:

The ammonia refrigeration system at the Rochester Meat facility is a two stage system. Consisting of a high side and a low pressure side. The low side is intended to quickly freeze product, while the high side is intended to refrigerate the product. The Ammonia Refrigeration system is protected by built in safeties to prevent a run away system.The built in safeties include Safety Relief Valves, Engine Room Ventilation, and system interlocks for pressure, temperature and liquid levels.



Worst-case Release Scenario for a Toxic Release

Although the worst case scenario is required by EPA it is an unlikely event. Design, construction, operation and government regulations are such that a catastrophic failure is extremely remote. Rochester Meat follows all codes in accordance with ASME, and Pressure and Vessel Codes.

The worst-case scenario release to toxic endpoint was determined using the RMP Comp guidelines for anhydrous ammonia. The scenario was based on the following criteria:

Vessel: Control Pressure Receiver

Amount Released 9,130 Lbs.

Duration of release 10 minutes

Release Rate 913 lbs/min

Atmospheric Stability F

Topography Urban

Based on RMP Comp the toxic endpoint for this worst case scenario is 0.90 miles down wind.



Alternative Release Scenario for a Toxic Release

The alternative worst case scenario release to t

oxic endpoint was determined using the RMP Comp guidelines for anhydrous ammonia. The scenario was based on the following criteria.

Vessel: Relief Valve Failure on the Pilot Receiver

Orifice Size A?A? inlet with a A?A? outlet

Amount Released 450 Lbs.

Duration of release 10 minutes

Release Rate 45 lbs/min

Atmospheric Stability F

Topography Urban

Based on RMP Comp the toxic endpoint for this worst case scenario is 0.10 miles down wind.

Rochester Meat Co. has implemented their PSM program under the OSHA regulation 29 CFR 1910.119 to assure that their ammonia refrigeration system is operating in an efficient and safe manner. In implementing their PSM program, Rochester Meat Co. has established written Standard Operating Procedures and Safe Maintenance Procedures to operate and maintain the ammonia refrigeration system.  Rochester Meat Co. has also outlined and implemented a training program to assure that well trained refrigeration operators and trained HAZMAT responders can safely and properly operate the ammonia system. Also Rochester Meat Co. has held tabletop and scenario drills with the Rochester Fire Dept. to coordinate efforts to minimize an offsite consequence that should occur.



Rochester Meat Co. is very dedicated to aligning their of the ammonia system to meet all of the regulations under the OSHA and EPA rulings regarding Anhydrous Ammonia. Rochester Meat Co.  has had their PSM program audited by the state OSHA and has received and Award Merit for their outstanding efforts in implementing their PSM program.  Rochester Meat Co.  is the only meat manufacture in the state on Minnesota to have received this award.
